result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A. Lein

records.addlTxt:
9:40 AM cases 21CF671, 21CF1010, 22CF681 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher A. Lein in court, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Christopher A. Lein. 
There is an agreement. 
In all files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
All files are referred to Branch 4 to schedule a plea hearing.

9:34 cases 21CF1010, 21CF671, 21CF681 called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher A. Lein in court, in custody with Attorney Roger M Hillestad. Attorney Hillestad states he needs time to go over discovery.
Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher A. Lein
Current: 3553 Fairfax Street #6, Eau Claire, WI 54701 United States  (Effective: 06-20-2022)
Prior: 2908 Birch St # 13, Eau Claire, WI 54703

(11:24 AM cases 21CF671, 21CF1010, 22CF681 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher A. Lein appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Christopher A. Lein.
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF681.
Defendant advised of charges and potential penalties.
State requests $5,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Anderson requests signature bond as the defendant is on probation.
Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on July 11, 2022 at 1:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
